intro: Steiropteris clypeolutata, commonly known as the Philippine tree fern, is a species native to the Philippines. It belongs to the family Dicksoniaceae and is characterized by its tall, slender trunk and large, feathery fronds. The plant is typically found in humid, shaded environments within tropical rainforests. Its rhizomes are thick and fibrous, providing structural support and facilitating growth. Steiropteris clypeolutata plays an important ecological role in its native habitat by contributing to soil stability and providing habitat for various organisms.
